name: 林哲宇
objective:
Contents:
1. Atomic structure, crystal structure, microstructure, and phase of materials
2. Mechanical properties of materials (fatigue, fracture, creep)
3. Electrical/optical/magnetic/thermal properties of materials, and 
4. Applications of materials in electromechanical structures.
Objectives: 
To improve the related knowledge of materials used in engineering processes
schedule:
Week 1 Introduction
Week 2 Type of materials
Week 3 Atomic Structure and Bonding
Week 4 Crystalline Structure Fundamentals
Week 5 Structure of Crystalline Solids
Week 6 Midterm exam (I)
Week 5 Imperfection in Solids
Week 6 Diffusion (time-independent)
Week 7 Diffusion (time-dependent)
Week 8 Mechanical Properties of Metals (elastic deformation)
Week 9 Mechanical Properties of Metals (plastic deformation)
Week 10 Dislocation and Slipping in Metals
Week 11 Strengthening Mechanisms
Week 12 Midterm (II)
Week 13 Fracture (ductile/brittle)
Week 14 Fatigue and Creep in Metals
Week 15 Phase Diagrams (Cu-Ni/Fe-C)
Week 16 Phase Transformation / Microstructure of Metals
Week 17 Application of Metals / Ceramics / Composites
Week 18 Final Exam
scorePolicy:
Midterm Exam (I) (25%, Close Book test)
Midterm Exam (II) (25%, Close Book test)
Final Exam (25%, Close Book test)
Student Presentation (15%)
Participance / Quiz / Rollcall (10%)
materials: Materials Science and Engineering, by Callister and Rethwisch, 10th ed., SI version, Wiley Pub.
課程對應SDGs指標: SDG7：可負擔的潔淨能源（Affordable and Clean Energy）SDG12：負責任的消費與生產（Responsible Consumption and Production）
